algorithm_technique: For each element, calculate how many odd-length subarrays it belongs to. The total sum is the sum of each element multiplied by its count of odd-length subarrays.
problem_summary_simple: Calculate the sum of all subarrays that have an odd number of elements.
problem_summary_technical: Determine the number of odd-length subarrays each element participates in and sum these contributions.
key_insights: An element at index `i` in an array of length `n` can be the start of `i + 1` subarrays and the end of `n - i` subarrays.
The total number of subarrays an element `arr[i]` belongs to is `(i + 1) * (n - i)`.
Exactly half of these subarrays will have odd length, which can be calculated using ceiling division: `ceil((i + 1) * (n - i) / 2)`.
